title: Thousands of dollars of goods stolen from Burnie's Rock Shop, police chief says
title_page: Thousands of dollars of goods stolen from Burnie's Rock Shop, police chief says
maintext:
Thousands of dollars of goods stolen from Burnie’s Rock Shop, police chief says
Burnie’s Rock Shop was broken into early Sunday morning with several thousands of dollars in merchandise being stolen, Madison police Chief Mike Koval said in his daily incident blog.
Officers went to the jewelry store at 901 E. Johnson St. around 1:15 a.m. after an alarm was triggered, Koval said. A window in the front of the store was smashed, and a trail of blood led away from the business, Koval said.
The store was checked by officers, and the robbery remains under investigation, he said.
A Sunday afternoon post on the Facebook page for Burnie’s Rock Shop appealed to the public for help in finding out who broke into the store.
The post said sterling silver chains, colored gemstone rings and pendants in silver had been stolen. Another post on the business’s Facebook page said the store would be closed Sunday and reopen on Tuesday.
Burnie’s Rock Shop, which specializes in rocks, minerals, gems and associated jewelry, started in 1962 and moved to its current East Johnson Street location from Monroe Street in 1976.
